org.switchyard

Interface Message


  • public interface Message
    A Message represents an individual input or output of a service, the content of which is interpreted by service implementation logic. A Message does not carry context specific to a service invocation, which means that it can be copied and reused across service invocations.

    There are two distinct parts to a message:

    • Content : the main body, or payload, of the message. There is only one body per message instance. The message body is mutable, so message processing logic can access the content, change it (transform, enrich, etc.), and then set it back on the message.

    • Attachments : provide the ability to associate content with a message separate from the main body, allowing it to be parsed independently. One example would be a binary image that is referenced by the main body of the message. The attachment may be too large to be processed in certain services or the service implementation may not be able to parse/interpret it.

    • Method Detail

      • getContext

        Context getContext()
        Retrieves the message context.
        Returns:
        the message context

      • setContent

        Message setContent(Object content)
        Assigns the specified content to the body of this message.
        Parameters:
        content - message body content
        Returns:
        this message instance.

      • getContent

        Object getContent()
        Returns the content from the body of the message.
        Returns:
        body content or null if the body has not been set

      • getContent

        <T> T getContent(Class<T> type)
        Convenience method used to retrieve a typed instance of the message body.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type
        Parameters:
        type - body content type
        Returns:
        body content or null if the body has not been set

      • addAttachment

        Message addAttachment(String name,
                    DataSource attachment)
        Adds an attachment to the message with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - attachment name
        attachment - attachment content
        Returns:
        this message instance.

      • getAttachment

        DataSource getAttachment(String name)
        Retrieves the named attachment from the message.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the attachment
        Returns:
        the named attachment or null if the attachment does not exist

      • removeAttachment

        void removeAttachment(String name)
        Removes the named attachment from this message.
        Parameters:
        name - the attachment name

      • getAttachmentMap

        Map<String,DataSource> getAttachmentMap()
        Returns a map containing all attachments to this message. The returned map is not a live reference to the underlying attachment map in the Message so changes to the returned map will not be reflected in the Message instance.
        Returns:
        a map containing all message attachments

      • copy

        Message copy()
        Return copy of message. The copy will contain clean context and point to same payload object. In other words contents of message is not cloned nor copied.
        Returns:
        copy of message.
